name: NumPy
description: The fundamental package for numerical computing in Python. It provides powerful N-dimensional array objects, linear algebra functions, Fourier transforms, random number capabilities, and more. It's the foundation for many other data science libraries.

name: Pandas
description: Built on top of NumPy, Pandas offers high-performance, easy-to-use data structures (like DataFrames) and data analysis tools. It's essential for data cleaning, manipulation, merging, reshaping, and analysis

name: Python
description: A popular programming language used in data science

name: Keras
description: used as part of machine learning

name: Matplotlib
description: The most established Python library for creating static, animated, and interactive visualizations. It provides a wide range of plot types (line plots, scatter plots, histograms, bar charts, etc.) and fine-grained control over plot elements.

name: Seaborn
description: Built on Matplotlib, Seaborn provides a higher-level interface for drawing attractive and informative statistical graphics. It simplifies creating complex visualizations like heatmaps, violin plots, pair plots, and integrates well with Pandas DataFrames

name: Scikit-learn
description: The go-to library for traditional machine learning algorithms. It offers efficient tools for data preprocessing, feature extraction, classification, regression, clustering, dimensionality reduction, model selection, and evaluation.
